alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 03 at 8:08AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Alabama and southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, in Alabama, Choctaw, Clarke, Monroe and Washington. In southeast Mississippi, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Monroeville, Jackson, Waynesboro, Frisco City, Grove Hill, Peterman, Whatley, Millry, Excel, Silas, Coffeeville, Winn, Salitpa, Mays Crossroads, Tattlersville, McVay, Clarksville, Zimco, Toddtown and McEntyre.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
